abstract.p: Dreyfus Corp unit of Mellon Bank Corp names Grace & Rothschild to handle its advertising account, with billings estimated at $12 million to $15 million; account had been handled by Citron Haligman Bedecarre (S)

block.p: The Dreyfus Corporation unit of the Mellon Bank Corporation said yesterday that it had named Grace & Rothschild in New York to handle its account, with billings estimated at $12 million to $15 million. The account had been handled for three years by Citron Haligman Bedecarre in San Francisco, which parted ways with Dreyfus in April.

The Dreyfus Corporation unit of the Mellon Bank Corporation said yesterday that it had named Grace & Rothschild in New York to handle its account, with billings estimated at $12 million to $15 million. The account had been handled for three years by Citron Haligman Bedecarre in San Francisco, which parted ways with Dreyfus in April.

Richard Roth, president at Richard Roth Associates in Chappaqua, N.Y., who helped manage a three-month review to select a new agency, said that the competition had been narrowed to Grace & Rothschild and two other finalists in New York: Angotti, Thomas, Hedge, a unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies, and Partners & Shevack, part of Wolf Group. Grace & Rothschild was a dark horse in the review because it had replaced a finalist -- Ammirati Puris Lintas in New York, also owned by Interpublic -- that withdrew because of a conflict.
